treatment.reference: The marine cyanobacterium Synechococcus sp. WH7805 requires urease (urea amidohydrolase, EC 3.5.1.5) to utilize urea as a nitrogen source: molecular-genetic and biochemical analysis of the enzyme (Collier, J., et al., 1999)
treatment.description: Synechococcus sp. strain WH7803, which could use either ammonium or nitrate but not urea.
